title: What's the best way to structure an IT infrastructure department? - Quora
tags: Jobs and Careers in Information Technology

response.answer_text: you know, the main responsibility of IT infrastructure department (ITID for short) is to guarantee certain SLA for applications; to maximum resource usage, to design the infrastructure with agility and scalability. to accomplish these goals, I see many ITID of large companies are divided into desktop helpdesk, hardware maintance and software maintance. desktop helpdesk is usually put out to outsourcing, harware maintance focuses on server, storage and network, software maintance focuses on hypervisor, OS and database. for maintainance guys are kind of hating changes, so there should be an architector or team keeps tabs on technology trend and works out phased plan for adopting new technologies like virtualization, BYOD, cloud, etc.
Sounds to me as it's not a structure issue,  it's a lack of defined responsibility. Just define people's roles,  and the structure will appear organically.
Just dont copy n Paste it like any other firm !!  and try to think n build according to your needs n your compny growth . vD
